_header: That ye forbear you fro all villainy
_description: Four Good Counsels, in a Latin sermon for the second Sunday in Quadragesima Hec est voluntas dei, sanctificacio vestra (1 Th. 4:3) — five lines, monoriming except the last

CULIi38.Transcription:
þat ȝe for bere ȝow fro alle vylenyeþat ȝe
                    wonye ȝow to gode þewes & curtesyeþat ȝe folwy
                    þe lawe off loue & chariteþat ȝe tale ȝeme to
                    þe state off dygniteþat god hat called ȝow to
CULIi38.Note:
Folio formerly numbered 100; line 2 repeated on f. 100v, line
                    3 on f. 101; line 4 paraphrased f. 101v.
CULIi38.Editions:
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             “More English Texts from MS. Cambridge University Library
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Anglia
         93 (1975): 1-16: 11.
